p.s: In his given speech Barack Obama makes use of some rhetorical devices to emphasize special parts of his speech.
Those will be explained in the following.

For example the enumeration geography and ideology, race and religion, wealth and opportunity (ll. 5f.) which is actually also a paralellismparallelism, should show up the many different values segregation can devidedivide a country.

But instead of EDIT for segregation Obama wants to show the audience the core values of America that America is fighting for and therefore the country including the audience havehas to stick together to achieve this.

By using the contrast which can be found in line 8 I haven't been struck by our differences - I've been impressed by the values and hopes that we share he refers to the enumeration above and shows that he does not see a country where the seperationseparation gets bigger and where the people doesdo not stick together.
Thus he wants the audience to get the feeling that he beliefsbelieves in America and that he will fight for the American Dream.
In addition the audience getgets the feeling that they can help by stopping racism, terrorism and so on to stick together and to stop the segregation.

Moreover he makes use of an anaphora no matter what color you are, no matter where you're from, no matter how much money you have (ll. 19f.) to refer to the Bill of Rights which are included in the American Dream and this appeals to the emotion of the audience because they get remind of how important the values or Bill of the American Dream can be for them.

Finally he uses a statistic data $12,000 a year (l. 22) to let the audience see how serious it is for him to be part when America is creating a better country so he wants to invideinvite them to be also a part and if more and more people are convince nobody has to give up all like he does as a community organiser.
So when everybody takstakes part it is not much they have to do to create a better country.
To conclude it can be said that Obama makes use of strong arguments, a great choice of language and memorable rhetorical devices to keep the audience in mind with his fighting for the American Dream.
